q: What are static class members, how are they created and what are they useful for?
What is a curry function and what are its advantages?
a: It's a function ( with a fixed number of parameters - f(a, b, c) ) transformed so that it allows us to call it partially ( f(a)(b)(c) - f(a) - f(b)(c) etc. ) .
It's what we use to send specific data from a server to a specific destination on the network.
ex: Say we want to set up a server on our computer to serve data to our website - we'll need to specify the port (number) through which our server will communicate with the client i.e. listen to the requests made on the client side.

a: They are numbers that inform us about the status of the request made to the server. There are several different types of responses each represented by a specific code range: 1** - informational, 2** - successful, 3** - redirection, 4** - client-side error, 5** - server-side error.
